following 2 row until work measures 30cm from the cast on point to live stitch edge measured straight up the middle of the triangle row 1 ws p all stitches row 2 rs k2 m1r k until 2 sts remain m1l k2 end on a rs row break the yarn leaving a 10 cm tail set the loose-knit triangle to the side leaving the stitches on the needle as is i-cord edging long edge knit the i-cord edge that runs across the long edge of the bandana as follows row 1 rs with your light worsted weight yarn and a 3 5mm us 4 dpn co 3 sts row 2 rs slide all three stitches to the right end of the dpn and use the yarn attached to the leftmost stitch holding it taut across the back of the stitches to k across all 3 stitches as normal in doing so you will form a tubular cord namely an i-cord © anouskaknits 2025 blueberry bandana august 2025 3 repeat row 2 until your i-cord measures 28cm knit into and along the live stitches from the loose-knit triangle as follows note to see these row demonstrated watch video 1 row 1-3 rs slip 1 stitch purlwise from the needle which holds the live sts from the loose-knit triangle this stitch is now on the dpn to the left of your i-cord sts slide all 4 sts to the right end of your dpn in i-cord k2 k2tog row 4 rs k3 to work an i-cord row without slipping a stitch from the live-stitch edge repeat these 4 row until all live sts have been worked repeat the following row until your i-cord measured from where the i-cord and loose-knit triangle join ends measures 28cm note i recommend knitting the first i-cord row using the tail of the fingering weight yarn together with your light worsted weight yarn held double stranded to help secure the live stitches that have just been worked into the i-cord edge unless knitting with contrasting colours it won t be noticeable row 1 rs working an i-cord row k3 you have completed the long edge of the i-cord bobble 3 sts right-hand triangle edge lay the bandana flat with the long i-cord edge you have just knit closest to you and the triangle pointing upwards ensure the rs of your work is face-up note to see the following step demonstrated watch video 2 © anouskaknits 2025 blueberry bandana august 2025 4 using your light worsted weight yarn and a 3 5mm us 4 dpn work from right to left to pick up and k into the 3 sts of the i-cord immediately next to the loose-knit triangle pick up the first edge stitch of the loose-knit triangle purlwise through
